DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents the kind of  gastrointestinal complication related to surgery.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Generalized Surgical Procedure Complication Digestive System
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Widespread, broadly dispersed, common._A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure._The system that includes the esophagus, stomach, small and large intestine, anus, liver, biliary tract, and pancreas.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Widespread, broadly dispersed, common.:A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
Any disease or disorder that occurs during the course of, or because of, another disease, treatment, or procedure.

Property.preferredDefinition: The system that includes the esophagus, stomach, small and large intestine, anus, liver, biliary tract, and pancreas.

Concepts.definition: The system that includes the esophagus, stomach, small and large intestine, anus, liver, biliary tract, and pancreas.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results or effects (does not include CTC Adverse Events) of therapeutic agents or procedures administered to the patient.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for Princess Margaret as requested by D.Laurence. mc 6/15/16

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

PermissibleValues.value: GI Bleed (specify upper or lower GI tract)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Bleeding originating from any part of the gastrointestinal tract.

Concepts.definition: Bleeding originating from any part of the gastrointestinal tract.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Decrease in peristalsis in the absence of a mechanical bowel obstruction.

Concepts.definition: Decrease in peristalsis in the absence of a mechanical bowel obstruction.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A hole or opening made through a membrane or other tissue or material.: The soft internal organs of the body, including the lungs, the heart, and the organs of the digestive, excretory, and reproductive systems.

Concepts.definition: A hole or opening made through a membrane or other tissue or material.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Be specific about something; define clearly.: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
